headline: Stacey Abrams says Georgia the worst state in the country to live, despite owning multiple houses there
author: Jessica Chasmar
sentences: "Im running for governor because I know that we have to have a conversation about who we are in this state and what we want for each other and from each other," Abrams said during a speech at the Gwinnett Democrats' Bluetopia Gala in Norcross, according to audio posted by the Gwinnett Daily Post.
Abrams, who is worth over $3 million and as of last year owned at least two houses in Georgia, later doubled down on her "worst state" comment on Twitter, writing that her Republican rival, Gov.
Abrams acknowledged such a statement would be "politicized" and further explained that her state has lots of room for improvement on issues like mental health and incarceration.
Democratic gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams declared Saturday that Georgia is "the worst state in the country to live," despite owning at least two houses there.
During her speech, Abrams said Kemp "has failed so miserably on so many accounts," including his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change.
"I am tired of hearing about how were the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live," she said.

Kemp fired back against Abrams in a tweet, saying Georgia "is the best state to live, work, and raise a family."
You dont have to be a Democrat to understand that criminal justice reform is the way forward," she said.
